str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lead, carry, take away; met: To be led astray, seduced. From apo and ago; to take off.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
Belonging to Cyrene, a Cyrenaean. From Kurene; i.e. Cyrenaean, i.e. Inhabitant of Cyrene.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
From behind, after. From opis with enclitic of source; from the rear, i.e. At the back.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
